org.sd.bdb
Class DbMap

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.bdb.DbMap

public class DbMap
extends java.lang.Object

Map class backed by a Berkeley DB.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Method Detail

createInstance

public static final DbMap createInstance(java.io.File backingFile,
                                         DbMap.Loader loader)
Create and load (if necessary) a DbMap instance from the given file and loader into the default db dir.

Note that the file is used as a location and naming reference for the backing db and the loader must use its own reference to the backing file.

Returns:
the loaded map or null if unable to load.

createInstance

public static final DbMap createInstance(java.io.File backingFile,
                                         DbMap.ResumableLoader loader)
Create and load (if necessary) a DbMap instance from the given file and loader into the default db dir.

Note that the file is used as a location and naming reference for the backing db and the loader must use its own reference to the backing file.

Returns:
the loaded map or null if unable to load.

Create and load (if necessary) a DbMap instance from the given file and loader into the default db dir.

Note that the file is used as a location and naming reference for the backing db and the loader must use its own reference to the backing file.

Returns:
the loaded map or null if unable to load.

                                         java.io.File dbDir,

Create and load (if necessary) a DbMap instance at the given dbDir with the given name using the loader.

                                         DbMap.ResumableLoader loader)

getDbDir

public static final java.io.File getDbDir(java.io.File fileDir,
                                          java.lang.String filename)
Get the default backing dbDir for a file.

NOTE: The default dbDir is fileDir/filename.bdb

markAsCompleted

public static final void markAsCompleted(java.io.File dbLocation)
Mark the dbLocation as a completed map.

Note that this will open backing DB's in read-only mode so that they can be shared, but they can no longer be added to.

size

public long size()
Get the number of entries in this map.

markAsCompleted

public void markAsCompleted()
Mark this map as complete, or fully loaded.

loadComplete

public boolean loadComplete(DbMap.ResumableLoader loader)
Load all of the data through the loader.

If the bdb directory exists, then If the completed marker file exists assume the file has been completely loaded; otherwise, skip through the file and start loading where it left off. Otherwise, begin loading the whole file.

When the file has been completely loaded, create the "complete marker" file in the bdb directory.

loadAllOrNothing

public boolean loadAllOrNothing(DbMap.Loader loader)
Load all of the data, or nothing. Assume that if the directory exists, all has already been loaded.

If all data is not successfully loaded, delete the backing db.

destroy

public void destroy()
Delete the backing db.

close

public void close()
Close the backing db.
